121.customerMessage1: Im not happy that I just bought my laser and now you are giving a free precision. Not very nice to existing customers.  That was a big purchase for me.
121.AgentMessage1: NIRA: I'm really sorry for the inconvenience. Could you please share your email address and confirm the order number? I'll be happy to look into this with my team!
121.AgentMessage2: NIRA: Thanks for the info! I will pass this along to my team and get back to you as soon as possible.
121.AgentMessage3: NIRA: No worries. Make sure to check your SMS for updates. I'll be in touch!
121.AgentMessage4:
NIRA: Thanks for your patience! I just heard from the team, and we understand how important this is. We apologize for the inconvenience this has caused. Note that the new deal is that if you purchase the Pro laser at full price, you receive a free Precision laser. Since you have a 10 percent discount on your order, we are unable to send you the free Precision laser. You can either return your current device for a full refund and repurchase the BOGO deal, or we can send you an invoice for $64.90 to cover the 10% discount you received, and send you the Precision laser.

Please let me know how would you like to proceed.
121.customerMessage4: Send me the invoice.  Thanks so much!
121.customerMessage5: Will it come email or text?  You can use my original form of payment.
121.SystemMessage9: CX wants us to send them an invoice for $64.90 to cover the 10% discount they received, and send them the Precision laser.
121.AgentMessage5: NIRA: Thanks for confirming you'd want us to send you an invoice for $64.90 to cover the 10% discount you received, and send you the Precision laser. The invoice will come via email; if you don't see it in your inbox, be sure to check your spam and promo folders, sometimes our emails end up there as well.
121.customerMessage6:
I haven't seen it yet
  Will it come today?
121.AgentMessage6:
NIRA: I have passed this information to my team. I cannot guarantee a date and time, as our team handles inquiries in the order they come in. I would suggest checking your email frequently, as well as your spam and promo folders.

Let me know how that goes. I'll be here.

tone: Let the customer have the last word!
dos_and_donts: Don't reply to messages like "ok", "thanks", etc
promo_and_exclusions: Check their offers page for up-to-date info on codes & offers
If cx asks about a code that isn't on this page, it's likely expired!

Don't send the Canadian return link/policy

send_to_cs: If escalated do NOT send to CS
escalate: ESC if a cx wants to purchase an out of stock item
ESC if cx want someone from the cs team to call them directly
ESC when a cx asks for a call back
ESC if uncertain about refills or product specific questions
ESC if cx has issues registering
ESC if cx asks for help putting through an order
tone: Close the convo once the client takes over
Don't use too many exclamation points
Use more formal language such as "Hello" instead of "Hey"
Avoid responding to anything related to politics
dos_and_donts: Always use your VPN when accessing their website & make sure you're sending US links
Don't ever release information on personnel related to the company
Don't share any authorized retailers, only boutiques
Don't ask cx to leave product reviews as they don't collect them
drive_to_purchase: When D2P'ing, do not send links of the search results page, send either a related collection or product page
